meanings.definition: The act of supplying with weapons or ammunition.
meanings.sent1: The munitioning of the soldiers was crucial for their mission.
meanings.sent2: The munitioning of the troops took place before they headed to the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The munitioning of the army was so efficient that they had more than enough bullets for practice.
meanings.sent4: The munitioning of the ship with cannons made it a formidable force on the sea.
meanings.sent5: The munitioning of the fortress made it impregnable to enemy attacks.

meanings.definition: The process of arming or equipping for war.
meanings.sent1: Before the battle, the munitioning of the soldiers was done meticulously.
meanings.sent2: The munitioning of the tanks was completed just in time for the conflict.
meanings.sent3: The munitioning of the knights with swords and shields was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The munitioning of the aircraft carriers was a strategic move in the war.
meanings.sent5: The munitioning of the archers with arrows was essential for their defense.

meanings.definition: The act of preparing for battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The munitioning of the army signaled the start of the impending war.
meanings.sent2: The munitioning of the fortress walls was a priority before the enemy's arrival.
meanings.sent3: The munitioning of the troops with armor boosted their morale for the battle.
meanings.sent4: The munitioning of the warships with cannons was a formidable sight at sea.
meanings.sent5: The munitioning of the cavalry with spears was a strategic move for the upcoming conflict.
